sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

x + 2y - z = 6

2x - y + 2z = -5

x + 3y + 4z = 9
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to rewrite the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 1  2 -1 |
    | 2 -1  2 |
    | 1  3  4 |

b = |  6  |
    | -5  |
    |  9  |

Now, we will perform QR decomposition on matrix A. QR decomposition is a process of decomposing a matrix A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal matrix Q and the upper triangular matrix R.

First, we need to find the orthonormal basis for the column space of A.

u1 = a1 = | 1 |
          | 2 |
          | 1 |

v1 = u1 / ||u1|| = | 1/√6  |
                   | 2/√6  |
                   | 1/√6  |

u2 = a2 - (a2·v1)v1 = | 2 - 2(2/√6) |
                       | -1 - 2(1/√6) |
                       | 3 - 2(1/√6) |

v2 = u2 / ||u2|| = | 1/√10  |
                   | -3/√10 |
                   | 2/√10  |

u3 = a3 - (a3·v1)v1 - (a3·v2)v2 = | -1 - (-1/√6) - (-1/√10) |
                                   | 2 - (2/√6) - (-3/√10) |
                                   | 4 - (1/√6) - (2/√10) |

v3 = u3 / ||u3|| = | -1/√35 |
                   |  4/√35 |
                   |  2/√35 |

Now, we can form the orthogonal matrix Q and the upper triangular matrix R.

Q = | 1/√6  1/√10 -1/√35 |
    | 2/√6 -3/√10  4/√35 |
    | 1/√6  2/√10  2/√35 |

R = | ||u1|| (v1·a1) (v1·a2) (v1·a3) | = | √6  2/√6  -1/√6  |
    |   0    ||u2|| (v2·a2) (v2·a3) |   |  0   √10  1/√10 |
    |   0      0    ||u3|| (v3·a3) |   |  0    0   √35   |

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb.

Q^Tb = | (1/√6)(6) + (2/√6)(-5) + (1/√6)(9)  |
       | (1/√10)(6) - (3/√10)(-5) + (2/√10)(9) |
       | (-1/√35)(6) + (4/√35)(-5) + (2/√35)(9) |

Q^Tb = |  2  |
       | -1  |
       |  1  |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^Tb using back-substitution.

z = 1 / √35
y = (-1 - 1/√10) / √10 = -2
x = (2 - 2/√6 + 2) / √6 = 1

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 1, y = -2, and z = 1/√35.
